data.title: Career as a Celebrity Manager in India 2023
data.meta_description: Want be help a talented person to come into the limelight? Become a Celebrity Manager. Read more to know about a career as a celebrity manager in this blog.
data.text:
We all have a celebrity that makes you skip a heartbeat. Or a celebrity that we all wish to see frequently on the screen, and hopefully someday in person.

Celebrity interviews give us a partial glimpse into their lives. Only to realize it is not an easy cup of tea (or coffee?). The name that always pops up in those interviews is “my manager’. Celebrity Managers manage projects, brand endorsement, promotions, and many other aspects connected to a celebrity’s professional life.

Ever wanted to be close to the limelight, but not exactly in the limelight? Celebrity manager might just be the career for you. Read the blog to learn more about a career as a celebrity manager, job roles, career paths, industries, and salary insights.

What does a Celebrity Manager do?

A celebrity manager manages and plans the schedules of famous people and represents, promotes, and advances their careers. Additionally, they manage promotional launches, events, appearances, parties, marketing, advertising campaigns, etc.

The nature of the job as a celebrity manager can typically take on three functions for their clients. They are:

An executive manager, will communicate on behalf of the client and oversee their activities.

A tour manager is typically required by stage performers such as musicians to manage tour venues and schedules.

A business manager, who takes care of the client’s investments and finances.

A celebrity manager may be responsible for a single or multiple celebrity clients, with their daily responsibilities in their career as a Celebrity Manager consisting of,

Overseeing social media accounts

Dealing with media outlets

Managing the schedules of their clients

Planning tours, travels, or public and media appearances

Creating marketing strategies for the celebrity’s brand and dealing with any negative press

Organising, negotiating and managing contracts for projects

Making sure the preferences of the celebrity is met

Providing advice for investments and finances

To successfully take on these responsibilities, a celebrity manager must be available to their clients at any time. This could entail late nights and 7 days of work weeks regularly.

Job Roles for a Celebrity Manager

Besides the previously mentioned typical job functions of a celebrity manager, there are several other job roles you can take on if you are looking to pursue a career as a celebrity manager. They are as follows:

Social Media Manager:

Manage the social media accounts, such as Instagram and Twitter for the celebrity. This role would also require you to advise on the sort of content the client can produce to help them stay trending and also true to their brand.

Public Relations Manager:

Not a role for the faint-hearted as you will be dealing with the press, and ensuring a positive image is portrayed of your client. You will also be managing public appearances that will help enhance the celebrity’s image.

Executive Assistant:

A role where you will always be at the side of the celebrity. The responsibilities of this role can entail anything from organizing personal events to simply getting them a coffee. Being at the beck and call of the celebrity is critical here.

Security Manager:

An individual in this role is very important to celebrities, as it is a question of the safety of their families and themselves.

Career paths for a Celebrity Manager

Through the blog, we will emphasize the skills you will have to master through experiences and courses to become a celebrity manager. Here’s a brief about pathways you can follow for a career as a Celebrity Manager-

Path I

Minimum of 60% in Grade 10

Diploma in Celebrity Management/Public Relations/Advertising

Graduation in PR/Business/Management/Mass Communication/Advertising or related fields.

Path II

Minimum of 60% in Grade 10

Minimum of 55% in Grade 12 (any stream)

Graduation in PR/Business/Management/Mass Communication/Advertising or related fields.

Internships are crucial to beginning your career as a Celebrity Manager. After completing either of the pathways, one can pursue a postgraduate degree in fields related to their undergraduate studies.

Salary in different stages of a career as a Celebrity Manager

A career as a celebrity manager is a niche one with limited growth opportunities in terms of job positions. However, that does not mean there is no growth in salary packages with relevant experience and scope of responsibilities.

The average annual salary package in a career as a celebrity manager is ₹8.5 lacs in India.

Skills Required to become a Celebrity Manager

The career skills that can help you become a successful celebrity manager are:

Administrative Skills: Because celebrity managers handle clients’ calendars and respond to calls and emails, among other tasks, much like personal or administrative assistants do, this set of skills is the foundation for success.

Negotiation Skills: Managers of celebrities who schedule performances, appearances, or roles for their clients should feel confident negotiating terms and conditions. They ought to exude confidence and persuasion.

Organization Skills: Celebrity managers may be in charge of several activities at once. They must be extremely well-organized, possess effective time-management techniques, and be able to multitask.

Interpersonal Skills: Because they deal with their clients, publicists, employers, and many other professionals every day, celebrity managers ought to like working with all kinds of individuals. They ought to be personable and at ease in social settings.

Technology Skills: Strong computer skills and familiarity with spreadsheets, scheduling software, digital calendars, communication tools, and email are prerequisites for celebrity managers. Additionally, they must know how to make the most of all the major social media platforms.

Event Planning Skills: Organising and planning personal events for their clients is a big part of a celebrity manager’s job. They will be required to oversee events such as birthday parties, screening events, and other private celebrations.

Social Media Skills: Social media plays a huge role in the persona a celebrity wants to portray. Knowing how to utilize social media and keeping up to date with trends would be a big plus to your career as a celebrity manager.

Is Celebrity Management a good career option?

The world will never be short of celebrities. Nowadays, it’s not only actors, athletes, or musicians that are celebrities. There are also up-and-coming influencers on social media platforms such as Instagram and TikTok that are considered celebrities.

According to the Bureau of Labour Statistics, the global celebrity management industry can see a growth of 20% in the next 10 years, due to the growing influencer personalities coming up.

Although it is a stable industry, there isn’t significant industry growth in the field of celebrity management. However, the allure of this industry is not from the growth of the industry itself, but rather the opportunity to work and be around celebrities.

Type of industries Hiring Celebrity Managers

The best industries to work in for a career as a celebrity manager would be those that have people with a mass following. That mostly tends to be the entertainment industry. The following industries are those that have high requirements for celebrity managers:

Bollywood

TV Entertainment

Social Media Influencers

Music Entertainment

Stage Performers

Top Recruiters for Celebrity Managers in India

Exceed Entertainment:

A renowned talent management agency that specializes in services such as social media influencer marketing, brand endorsements, merchandising, and film/tv marketing.

HT Media:

A mass media company based out of Delhi, they are known to create award-winning content in various forms of media.

Qyuki Digital Media:

A platform for up-and-coming performing artists and creative minds to earn money from their work, founded by Shekhar Kapur, AR Rahman and Samir Bangara.

Approach Entertainment:

An award-winning film production organization headquartered in Mumbai. They also heavily focus on celebrity management.

Rapid Kings:

A leading talent management agency that deals with top artists in various industries such as Bollywood, music, and stand-up comedy.

Yuvraj Entertainment:

Exclusively for music talent, they are a well-reputed booking agency for a multitude of popular singers.

Courses to upskill as a Celebrity Manager

If you are interested in pursuing a career as a celebrity manager, it is always a good idea to supplement your bachelor’s degree in any field with a specific certificate course. Here are some certificate courses you can explore for a career as a celebrity manager.

Certificate in Celebrity Management

Public Relations: Best Practices and Ethics by Saylor Foundation.

Certificate program in celebrity management (CPCM) by the Institute of Event Management (IEM)

Specialization Certificate program in Celebrity Management

Executive Development in Talent Management

Certificate in Talent Management

Certificate in Artist Management

Celebrity Management Certification NDIEM

Certificate program in advertising and public relations by Welinkar Education

Qualifications to become a Celebrity Manager

A specific set of credentials, experience, and skills are required for a celebrity manager. Three to four years of undergraduate programs and experience in either marketing or public relations may be required for a celebrity manager position.

Degrees in India

A celebrity manager needs to have the same education and experience as anyone of education and experience as anyone working in a senior management role. An option is a three-year bachelor’s degree in corporate management, marketing, public relations, media, or finance.

A bachelor’s degree in literature, film, or arts administration is equally suitable.

UG degree

A commercial approach and financial understanding are required to become a successful celebrity manager. The eligibility criteria and top colleges are discussed in our blog- How to become a Celebrity Manager.

Here are a few undergraduate degrees you can opt for to start a career as a celebrity:

Bachelors in Bussiness Management

Bachelors in Management Studies

BA in Economics and Business Administration

BA (Hons) in Advertising, PR and Media

Bachelors in Journalism and Mass Communication

PG degree

The eligibility criteria for applying for a postgraduate degree in India are a minimum of 55% or equivalent grade point average in bachelors and university entrance exam scores.

Here are a few postgraduate degrees you can opt for to start a career as a celebrity:

Degrees Abroad

In case you are interested in studying abroad, think of applying to universities in a city with significant art, sports, or entertainment sectors, such as New York or Los Angeles. In these places, there may be more opportunities for you to connect with industry insiders and find internships.

The eligibility criteria for an undergraduate degree are discussed in our previous blog. One can opt to pursue a bachelor’s in Communication & Public Relations/Fashion Management & Marketing/ Communication and Media: Concentration in Public Relations/Marketing, Advertising, and Public Relations/Branding.

To apply for a postgraduate degree abroad in PR/Marketing/advertising, one should meet the following criteria:

A minimum of 55% or equivalent grade point average in a bachelor’s.

Language proficiency test scores – TOEFL, IELTS, PTE.

Application essay/questionnaire.

Letter of recommendation/ statement of purpose.
